alert.note: Alert for Clark; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 12 at 5:43AM CST until January 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Dangerous Winter Storm Today Through Early Saturday... .Snow has been developing early this morning from south to north with many roads near and south of Interstate 90 reported to be slippery or snow-covered. Snow will continue to increase this morning with rates as high as 1 inch per hour at times, especially across far northeast Iowa through southwest and central Wisconsin. Winds will increase later today leading to blowing and drifting in open areas. Travel will become hazardous for most of the region, potentially impossible where snowfall and winds are the highest. Consider altering, delaying or even canceling travel plans if conditions warrant it. Bitterly cold air arrives as this storm system exits the area with wind chills of 20 to 30 below by Saturday night. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph this afternoon and tonight producing blowing and drifting snow in open areas. * WHERE...Taylor and Clark Counties. * WHEN...Until noon CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility with localized whiteouts possible. Sporadic power outages could occur. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
